Must satisfy\n           2 <= k <= npos. Default: k = 4.\n        wraparound : boolean, optional\n           Flag indicating whether or not the parametrized curve should be\n           configured such that s = 0 and s = 1 correspond to the same point.\n           Default: wraparound = False.\n        pad_points : integer, optional\n           Integer number of points to pad to either side of the points of the\n           curve. Intended to facilitate a smoother joint when wraparound is\n           True, i.e., when emulating periodic boundary conditions.\n           Default: pad_points = 0.\n        extrap : boolean, optional\n           Flag indicating whethe ror not the interpolation object should\n           allow extrapolation when evaluated for s < 0 or s > 1. Note that\n           extrapolation is generally not advised, as the results are\n           by no means guaranteed to be sensible. Default: extrap = False.\n\n        The parameter s is readily available as a Python readonly memoryview.\n        It can be extracted e.g. by means of a list comprehension, such as\n\n            'npos, ndim = 40, 2\n             phi = np.linspace(0,2*np.pi,npos,endpoint=False)\n             r = 0.5 + np.cos(phi)\n             x = np.empty((npos,ndim))\n             x[...,0], x[...,1] = r*np.cos(phi), r*np.sin(phi)\n             interp = NDCurveBSplineInterpolator(x,k=""3,wraparound=True)\n             s_external = [s for s in interp.s]\n             (...)\n            '\n\n        ";

 064:         """NDCurveBSplineInterpolator(x,k,wraparound,pad_points,extrap)
 065: 
 066:         Constructor for a B-spline interpolation of an N-dimensional curve,
 067:         where each curve coordinate is parametrized as a function of
 068:         a normalized pseudo-arclength parameter 0 <= s <= 1.
 069: 
 070:         Parameters
 071:         ----------
 072:         x : (npos,ndim) array-like
 073:            A (C-contiguous) NumPy array of shape (npos,ndim) and type
 074:            np.float64, containing the (Cartesian) coordinates of the pointwise
 075:            parametrized curve.
 076:         k : Integer, optional
 077:            Interpolation order (along all abscissae). Must satisfy
 078:            2 <= k <= npos. Default: k = 4.
 079:         wraparound : boolean, optional
 080:            Flag indicating whether or not the parametrized curve should be
 081:            configured such that s = 0 and s = 1 correspond to the same point.
 082:            Default: wraparound = False.
 083:         pad_points : integer, optional
 084:            Integer number of points to pad to either side of the points of the
 085:            curve. Intended to facilitate a smoother joint when wraparound is
 086:            True, i.e., when emulating periodic boundary conditions.
 087:            Default: pad_points = 0.
 088:         extrap : boolean, optional
 089:            Flag indicating whethe ror not the interpolation object should
 090:            allow extrapolation when evaluated for s < 0 or s > 1. Note that
 091:            extrapolation is generally not advised, as the results are
 092:            by no means guaranteed to be sensible. Default: extrap = False.
 093: 
 094:         The parameter s is readily available as a Python readonly memoryview.
 095:         It can be extracted e.g. by means of a list comprehension, such as
 096: 
 097:             'npos, ndim = 40, 2
 098:              phi = np.linspace(0,2*np.pi,npos,endpoint=False)
 099:              r = 0.5 + np.cos(phi)
 100:              x = np.empty((npos,ndim))
 101:              x[...,0], x[...,1] = r*np.cos(phi), r*np.sin(phi)
 102:              interp = NDCurveBSplineInterpolator(x,k=3,wraparound=True)
 103:              s_external = [s for s in interp.s]
 104:              (...)
